name: Mahaletchumy Arujunan
description: Malaysian-Indian Biologist currently serving as the executive director of the Malaysian Biotechnology Information Centre, the founding editor-in-chief of the first Malaysian science newspaper, and social advocate for gender equity in STEM research and education

name: Chien-Shiung Wu
description: Chinese-American experimental physicist who made significant contributions in the field of nuclear physics. Known as 'the First Lady of Physics' and 'Queen of Nuclear Research', and won the National Medal of Science in 1975

name: Kalpana Chawla
description: The first woman of Indian descent to go to space. Member of the Columbia Space Shuttle crew STS-107. Posthumously awarded the Congressional Space Medal of Honor

name: Tomoko Ohta
description: Japanese Biologist working on population genetics and molecular evolution. Her work has awarded her the Crafoord Prize (2015) and an induction into the National Academy of Sciences

name: Deborah S. Jin
description: Considered an innovator in polar molecular quantum chemistry and fellow of the National Institute of Standards and Technology

name: Roseli Ocampo-Friedman
description: Filipino-American specialized in the study of cyanobacteria and extremophiles. Her work has been cited in work exploring the terraforming of Mars
